from.name: Import identifier
from.title: from %library% import %reference%
from.description: A from statement causes a process to import a certain identifier.

import.name: Import module
import.title: import %reference%
import.description: A import statement causes a process to import a module.

if.name: If...then
if.title: if %condition% then
if.description: The content of an if statement is executed if the condition is true.

elif.name: Else if
elif.title: else if %condition% then
elif.description: The content of an else if statement is executed it the previous condition wasn't true, but his is.

else.name: Else
else.title: else
else.description: The content of an else is executed if all the other conditions are false.

def.name: Define a function
def.title: define function %function_name% (%parameters%)
def.description: Creates a function that with the functionality contained in the block.

try.name: Try statement
try.description:
Tries to execute its content and passes any errors to the following except-statement.
Warning: If there is no following except-statement, the errors will be suppressed.

except.name: Exception handler
except.description: If an error occured in the previous try-statement, the content will be executed.

for.name: For...each
for.title: for each %item% in %collection%
for.description: Executes it content once for each item in the collection.

while.name: While-loop
while.title: while %condition%
while.description:
Executes its content as long as the condition is true.
Warning, this can cause the process to go into an infinite loop and hang.

@assign.name: Variable assignment
@assign.title: %assignments%=%parameters%
@assign.description: Assigns a value to the specified variable.

@call.name: Function call
@call.title:
Call %functionName%
with %parameters%
@call.description: Call a function with the provided parameters

#!customstart.title: Custom code
#!customstart.name: Custom code
#!customstart.description:
Can contain any Python 3 compliant code.
WarningAs this can contain any code, care should be taken with what is entered here.
